titles.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 107) expressing the sense of the Congress that the award of attorneys' fees, costs, and sanctions of $285,864.78 ordered by United States District Judge Royce C. Lamberth on December 18, 1997, should not be paid with taxpayer funds.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-412, by Mr. Goss.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 107 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 141.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/3/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.J. Res. 107 (use of taxpayer funds for payment of specified attorney's fees).
